intro: Agonandra brasiliensis subsp. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian agonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
